meanings.definition: Capable of being traced or tracked.
meanings.sent1: The footprints left in the snow were easily traceable.
meanings.sent2: The detective found a traceable clue at the crime scene.
meanings.sent3: It was a traceable puzzle, but the solution was right in front of us.
meanings.sent4: Her influence on the team was traceable, even after she left.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh cookies was traceable all the way to the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Able to be followed or identified.
meanings.sent1: The map provided a traceable route to the hidden treasure.
meanings.sent2: The suspect's movements were easily traceable through security cameras.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meows were traceable to the backyard, where it got stuck in a tree.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was traceable in every small gesture she made.
meanings.sent5: The sound of laughter was traceable to the children playing in the park.

meanings.sent1: The missing keys were traceable to the coat pocket.
meanings.sent2: The origins of the ancient artifact were not easily traceable.
meanings.sent3: The recipe's secret ingredient was traceable only to Grandma's handwritten notes.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music was traceable in every note he played.
meanings.sent5: The source of the mysterious sound was traceable to the old attic.
